bill_title: require students in grades one and two to be tested before being promoted to the next grade.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require students in grades one and two to be tested before being promoted to the next grade. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-3 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Each elementary school shall annually assess each student in grade one and grade two to measure the level of each student's achievement to determine if the student should be promoted to the next grade. If the assessment indicates that the student is not proficient in the areas assessed, the student may not be promoted to the next grade. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.098 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
